ingredients: 1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
cooking_method:
1. Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add garlic and chilies and stir-fry for 30 seconds.
2. Add chicken and stir-fry until cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.
3. Add bell pepper and onion and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes.
4. Add oyster sauce, soy sauce, fish sauce, and sugar and stir-fry for another 1-2 minutes.
5. Remove from heat and stir in basil leaves.
6. Serve hot with rice.

rating.comment: This was delicious and so easy to make!
Great recipe, but a little too spicy for me!
Not bad, but I've had better Thai food.

cooking_method:
1. Preheat oven to 450°F.
2. Roll out pizza dough and place on a greased pizza pan or baking sheet.
3. Spread tomato sauce evenly over the dough.
4. Top with mozzarella cheese and parmesan cheese.
5. Bake for 12-15 minutes, until crust is golden brown and cheese is melted and bubbly.
6. Remove from oven and top with fresh basil leaves.
7. Slice and serve hot.

rating.comment: This pizza is a classic for a reason. Perfectly balanced and delicious!
As a vegetarian, I love a good margherita pizza. This one did not disappoint!
I added some sautéed mushrooms to this recipe and it was amazing.

ingredients: 1 lb. large shrimp, peeled and deveined
cooking_method:
1. Cook linguine according to package directions until al dente.
2. Meanwhile, heat butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
3. Add garlic and sauté until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
4. Add shrimp and cook until pink and cooked through, about 3-4 minutes.
5. Reduce heat to low and add heavy cream and parmesan cheese, stirring until cheese is melted and sauce is smooth.
6. Drain linguine and add to the skillet, tossing to coat with the sauce.
7. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Garnish with chopped parsley and serve hot.

rating.comment: This was amazing! Creamy and full of flavor.
I loved this recipe, but I added some extra garlic for even more flavor!
Not bad, but a little too heavy for my taste.
